statements: SELECT * FROM customers WHERE city='New York';
SELECT customer_name, total_purchases FROM customers WHERE gender='Female' ORDER BY total_purchases DESC;
SELECT customer_name, age FROM customers WHERE age > 30 AND gender='Male';
SELECT customer_id, customer_name FROM customers ORDER BY customer_id ASC;
SELECT city, COUNT(*) as total_customers FROM customers GROUP BY city HAVING COUNT(*) > 1;
SELECT * FROM customers WHERE age > 30 ORDER BY total_purchases DESC, customer_name ASC LIMIT 10
SELECT customer_name, city FROM customers WHERE gender='Female' ORDER BY city DESC
SELECT customer_name, age, total_purchases FROM customers WHERE city='New York' AND age BETWEEN 25 AND 40
SELECT customer_name, gender, first_purchase_date, last_purchase_date FROM customers WHERE total_purchases > 5000 ORDER BY first_purchase_date ASC
SELECT count(*) as total_customers, AVG(age) as avg_age FROM customers GROUP BY city HAVING total_purchases > 10000
SELECT * FROM customers;
SELECT first_name, last_name, age FROM customers WHERE age > 30;
SELECT customer_id, email, phone_number FROM customers ORDER BY customer_id DESC;
SELECT * FROM purchases WHERE purchase_date BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-12-31';
SELECT customer_id, SUM(price*quantity) AS total_spent FROM purchases GROUP BY customer_id HAVING SUM(price*quantity) > 1000;
SELECT first_name, last_name, email FROM customers WHERE age >= 18 AND gender = 'Female' ORDER BY last_name ASC;
SELECT AVG(age) AS avg_age, gender FROM customers GROUP BY gender;
SELECT c.first_name, c.last_name, p.product_name, p.price FROM customers c JOIN purchases p ON c.customer_id = p.customer_id WHERE p.price > 100 ORDER BY p.price DESC;
SELECT first_name, last_name, age FROM customers WHERE age BETWEEN 25 AND 35;
SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT customer_id) AS total_customers, SUM(price * quantity) AS total_spent FROM customers JOIN purchases ON customers.customer_id = purchases.customer_id;
SELECT * FROM customers;
SELECT first_name, last_name, city FROM customers;
SELECT customer_id, age, city FROM customers WHERE age > 30;
SELECT * FROM purchases ORDER BY purchase_date DESC;
SELECT customer_id, gender, income FROM demographics WHERE income > 50000;
SELECT * FROM customers WHERE age > 30 ORDER BY last_name DESC, first_name ASC;
SELECT customer_id, first_name, last_name, city FROM customers WHERE city = 'New York';
SELECT customer_id, gender, income, interests FROM demographics WHERE income > 50000;
SELECT customer_id, first_name, last_name, city FROM customers JOIN demographics ON customers.customer_id = demographics.customer_id;
SELECT customer_id, first_name, last_name, purchase_date, item_name, total_amount FROM customers INNER JOIN purchases ON customers.customer_id = purchases.customer_id;
SELECT * FROM customers WHERE age > 30;
SELECT name, gender FROM customers WHERE city = 'New York';
SELECT customer_id, age, city FROM customers ORDER BY age DESC;
SELECT customer_id, COUNT(*) AS purchase_count FROM purchases GROUP BY customer_id;
SELECT customer_id, income FROM demographics WHERE income > 50000;
SELECT * FROM customers WHERE age > 30;
SELECT name, city FROM customers WHERE gender = 'Female';
SELECT customer_id, name, age, city FROM customers WHERE city = 'New York' AND age < 50;
SELECT purchase_date, amount FROM purchases WHERE product_id = 101 ORDER BY purchase_date DESC;
SELECT customer_id, income, education, occupation FROM demographics WHERE income > 50000 ORDER BY income DESC, education ASC;
SELECT * FROM customers;
SELECT name, age, gender FROM customers WHERE age > 30;
SELECT product_name, price FROM products ORDER BY price DESC;
SELECT * FROM purchases WHERE purchase_date BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-06-30';
SELECT customer_id, region, income FROM demographics WHERE income > 50000 ORDER BY income DESC;
SELECT * FROM customers;
SELECT name, age, gender FROM customers WHERE age > 30;
SELECT product_name, category, price FROM products ORDER BY price DESC;

SELECT customers.name, purchases.purchase_date, products.product_name, purchases.quantity FROM customers INNER JOIN purchases ON customers.id = purchases.customer_id INNER JOIN products ON purchases.product_id = products.product_id;

SELECT customers.name, demographics.region, demographics.income, marketing_segments.segment_name FROM customers INNER JOIN demographics ON customers.id = demographics.customer_id INNER JOIN marketing_segments ON demographics.customer_id = marketing_segments.segment_id;
